title: EVM out of memory exception during bytecode processing
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.8.3-unstable-62bc179b`
OS & Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

#### Expected behaviour
The EVM should process the given bytecode sequence and provide the appropriated. 

#### Actual behaviour
The EVM crashes with an `out of memory` exception at program count 10 (bytecode `f3`). This happens after the EVM consumes all of the memory and swap. The given bytecode sequence to the EVM is: `435b5944425b59594243f3`. The crash happens every time I execute this statement. 


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Execute the following statement: 
`/evms/geth-evm --code 435b5944425b59594243f3 --prestate /tmp/genesis-geth.json --gas 1152921504606846975 --nomemory --nostack --json run`

The given genesis file is the following:

So, the code is
```
NUMBER
JUMPDEST
MSIZE
DIFFICULTY
TIMESTAMP
JUMPDEST
MSIZE
MSIZE
TIMESTAMP
NUMBER
RETURN 
```
Basically, "Put some arbitrary large numbers on the stack, then do `RETURN` with data of size `TIMESTAMP` starting from memory position `NUMBER`"

Normally, that would go out of gas, since `TIMESTAMP` is rather large. However, since you also supply it with 1.152 TRILLION gas, it just goes ahead and tries to allocate that for you. 

The mainnet has 8 MILLION gas per block -- it's easy to crash the VM by using orders of magnitude more gas .
